{"step_by_step_thinking": "Pellicle formation is the first step in the formation of dental plaque. It involves the adsorption of salivary proteins, including acidic glycoproteins, onto the tooth surface. This forms a thin, acellular, organic film. It does not involve mineralisation, necrosis, or bacterial colonization, although the pellicle does provide a surface for bacteria to adhere to in later stages of plaque formation.", "answer_choice": "A"}
